author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet all of the guidelines for automatic merging.

Specifically, your pull request does not meet the following guidelines:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with a capital letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, ends in lowercase
- Name is not at least five characters long
- Repo URL does not end with /name.jl.git, where name is the package name
- The following dependencies do not have a compat entry that has an upper bound: EzXML

If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment.

(If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.)

---
It is important to note that if your pull request does not meet the guidelines for automatic merging, this does not mean that your pull request will never be merged. It just means that your pull request will require manual review by a human.

> These guidelines are intended not as requirements for packages but as very conservative guidelines, which, if your new package or new version of a package meets them, it may be automatically merged.

---
On a separate note, I see that you are registering a release with a version number of the form `v0.X.Y`.

Does your package have a stable public API? If so, then it's time for you to register version `v1.0.0` of your package. (This is not a requirement. It's just a recommendation.)

If your package does not yet have a stable public API, then of course you are not yet ready to release version `v1.0.0`.

---
[noblock]

[noblock]

When you merge this PR, please merge https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/4773 too. V0.2.0 is more functional and stable.

Thank you!

[noblock]
What does AML stand for? Acute myeloid leukemia? The readme does not help.

AML is similar to HTML and XML which stand for `Hypertext Markup Language` and `Extensible Markup Language` respectively.
AML : can be implied as `A Markup Language` which is an `Automatic Markup Language` and  `Acute Markup Language` which can also be called `Amin Markup Language` ðŸ˜„ . Because it is an intelligent and acute markup language for HTML/XML creation/extraction, I picked this name.

> AML is similar to HTML and XML which stand for Hypertext Markup Language and Extensible Markup Language respectively.

Okay, but those are well-known acronyms.

> AML : can be implied as A Markup Language which is an Acute Markup Language which can also be called AMin Language smile . Because it is intelligent and acute markup language for HTML/XML creation/extraction, I picked this name.

Wouldn't AcuteMarkupLanguage be a better name then?

@fredrikekre 
The spelling of AcuteMarkupLanguage is hard. Also because not many people know what XML and HTML stand for, and they are used as `words that mean something on their own`, 

I prefer to pick AML. 
There's also one macro in the package with the same name, which is used for type creation `@aml`

I am sure that AML is the best name, but when I picked it, I had many things in my mind that A could point to like (Auto, Acute, A, etc)

Here is a full list of markup languages: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_markup_languages
Most of them are acronyms with ML in the end

I like `AcuteMarkup`.

Initially I thought about `AcuteML`. Then it occured to me that people often use "ML" to refer to "machine learning". So if you name your package `AcuteML`, people might erroneously think it is related to machine learning.

If you go to this link you see a lot of markup languages ending with ML (I think most of them existed before machine learning  ðŸ˜„ ), like `MathML`, `YAML`
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_markup_languages

I wish we could have the name aliases.
`AcuteML` is fine by me if you like that name.
@DilumAluthge let me change the name and submit it. I don't know how to change this PR though. I already have made https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/4773
I have closed this PR as well as #4773. Now you can rename your package and register it under the new name.
